oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wesley Rose - TN Homecoming '86
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is a promotion for Tennessee Homecoming '86. Wesley Rose provides a brief history of Acuff/Rose.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wesley Rose
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:19) -- Wesley Rose describes the birth of Acuff/Rose. Wesley describes the handshake that started the company between Fred Rose and Roy Acuff. (0:40) -- In 1948, Acuff/Rose signed Pee Wee King & Redd Stewart. Acuff/Rose published a song in 1948 named "Tennessee Waltz." (0:48) -- Wesley Rose mentions that Acuff/Rose signed Hank Williams in that same year, 1948. (1:00) --Wesley Rose goes on to describe Acuff/Rose's several accomplished songwriters & musicians such as - Don Gibson, The Everly Brothers, Roy Orbison, John Loudermilk, Marty Robbins, Fred Rose, and Boudleaux & Felice Bryant. (1:14) -- Wesley Rose mentions that Acuff/Rose recently joined with Opryland. "I'm really proud to say that we are now known as Acuff/Rose Opryland Music." - Wesley Rose.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rose, Wesley;
